member.name: T:QuickGraph.Petri.IPlace`1
member.summary: A Place in the HLPN framework

remarks.para: A is characterized by a set of tokens, called the of the place. The place is typed by the instance. This means only object of assignable to can reside in the place.
Usually represented by an ellipses (often circles).

member.summary: Invoked on the source vertex once before the start of the search.

member.summary: Invoked on the first edge of a test case

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Search.ImplicitEdgeDepthFirstSearchAlgorithm`2.TreeEdge
member.summary: Invoked on each edge as it becomes a member of the edges that form the search tree. If you wish to record predecessors, do so at this event point.

member.summary: Invoked on the back edges in the graph.

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Search.ImplicitEdgeDepthFirstSearchAlgorithm`2.ForwardOrCrossEdge
member.summary: Invoked on forward or cross edges in the graph. (In an undirected graph this method is never called.)

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Search.ImplicitEdgeDepthFirstSearchAlgorithm`2.FinishEdge
member.summary: Invoked on a edge after all of its out edges have been added to the search tree and all of the adjacent vertices have been discovered (but before their out-edges have been examined).

member.name: T:QuickGraph.Serialization.GraphMLSerializer`3
member.summary: A GraphML ( http://graphml.graphdrawing.org/ ) format serializer.

remarks.para: Custom vertex, edge and graph attributes can be specified by using the attribute on properties (field not suppored).

The serializer uses LCG (lightweight code generation) to generate the methods that writes the attributes to avoid paying the price of Reflection on each vertex/edge. Since nothing is for free, the first time you will use the serializer *on a particular pair of types*, it will have to bake that method.
Hyperedge, nodes, nested graphs not supported.

member.name: T:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Search.BidirectionalDepthFirstSearchAlgorithm`2
member.summary: A depth and height first search algorithm for directed graphs
member.remarks: This is a modified version of the classic DFS algorithm where the search is performed both in depth and height.

member.name: T:QuickGraph.Serialization.GraphMLDeserializer`3
member.summary: A GraphML ( http://graphml.graphdrawing.org/ ) format deserializer.

remarks.para: Custom vertex, edge and graph attributes can be specified by using the attribute on properties (field not suppored).

The serializer uses LCG (lightweight code generation) to generate the methods that writes the attributes to avoid paying the price of Reflection on each vertex/edge. Since nothing is for free, the first time you will use the serializer *on a particular pair of types*, it will have to bake that method.
Hyperedge, nodes, nested graphs not supported.

member.summary: Invoked on the source vertex once before the start of the search.

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Search.ImplicitDepthFirstSearchAlgorithm`2.DiscoverVertex
member.summary: Invoked when a vertex is encountered for the first time.

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Search.ImplicitDepthFirstSearchAlgorithm`2.ExamineEdge
member.summary: Invoked on every out-edge of each vertex after it is discovered.

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Search.ImplicitDepthFirstSearchAlgorithm`2.TreeEdge
member.summary: Invoked on each edge as it becomes a member of the edges that form the search tree. If you wish to record predecessors, do so at this event point.

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Search.ImplicitDepthFirstSearchAlgorithm`2.BackEdge
member.summary: Invoked on the back edges in the graph.

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Search.ImplicitDepthFirstSearchAlgorithm`2.ForwardOrCrossEdge
member.summary: Invoked on forward or cross edges in the graph. (In an undirected graph this method is never called.)

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Search.ImplicitDepthFirstSearchAlgorithm`2.FinishVertex
member.summary: Invoked on a vertex after all of its out edges have been added to the search tree and all of the adjacent vertices have been discovered (but before their out-edges have been examined).

member.summary: A single-source shortest path algorithm for directed acyclic graph.

member.name: T:QuickGraph.Algorithms.ShortestPath.BellmanFordShortestPathAlgorithm`2
member.summary: Bellman Ford shortest path algorithm.

remarks.para: The Bellman-Ford algorithm solves the single-source shortest paths problem for a graph with both positive and negative edge weights.
If you only need to solve the shortest paths problem for positive edge weights, Dijkstra's algorithm provides a more efficient alternative.
If all the edge weights are all equal to one then breadth-first search provides an even more efficient alternative.

member.name: M:QuickGraph.Algorithms.ShortestPath.BellmanFordShortestPathAlgorithm`2.OnInitializeVertex(`0)
member.summary: Raises the event.

member.summary: Raises the event.

member.summary: Raises the event.

member.summary: Raises the event.

member.summary: Raises the event.

member.name: M:QuickGraph.Algorithms.ShortestPath.BellmanFordShortestPathAlgorithm`2.InternalCompute
member.summary: Applies the Bellman Ford algorithm
member.remarks: Does not initialize the predecessor and distance map.
member.returns: true if successful, false if there was a negative cycle.

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.ShortestPath.BellmanFordShortestPathAlgorithm`2.InitializeVertex
member.summary: Invoked on each vertex in the graph before the start of the algorithm.

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.ShortestPath.BellmanFordShortestPathAlgorithm`2.ExamineEdge
member.summary: Invoked on every edge in the graph |V| times.

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.ShortestPath.BellmanFordShortestPathAlgorithm`2.EdgeNotRelaxed
member.summary: Invoked if the distance label for the target vertex is not decreased.

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.ShortestPath.BellmanFordShortestPathAlgorithm`2.EdgeMinimized
member.summary:
Invoked during the second stage of the algorithm, during the test of whether each edge was minimized.
If the edge is minimized then this function is invoked.

member.name: E:QuickGraph.Algorithms.ShortestPath.BellmanFordShortestPathAlgorithm`2.EdgeNotMinimized
member.summary:
Invoked during the second stage of the algorithm, during the test of whether each edge was minimized.
If the edge was not minimized, this function is invoked. This happens when there is a negative cycle in the graph.

member.summary: Constructed predecessor map

member.name: M:QuickGraph.Algorithms.EulerianTrailAlgorithm`2.Trails
member.summary: Computes the set of eulerian trails that traverse the edge set.
member.remarks: This method returns a set of disjoint eulerian trails. This set of trails spans the entire set of edges.
member.returns: Eulerian trail set

member.name: M:QuickGraph.Algorithms.EulerianTrailAlgorithm`2.Trails(`0)
member.summary: Computes a set of eulerian trail, starting at that spans the entire graph.

remarks.para: This method computes a set of eulerian trail starting at that spans the entire graph.The algorithm outline is as follows:
The algorithms iterates throught the Eulerian circuit of the augmented graph (the augmented graph is the graph with additional edges to make the number of odd vertices even).
If the current edge is not temporary, it is added to the current trail.

If the current edge is temporary, the current trail is finished and added to the trail collection. The shortest path between the start vertex and the target vertex of the temporary edge is then used to start the new trail. This shortest path is computed using the .

member.returns: eulerian trail set, all starting at s
